Wins Google in antitrust lawsuit
and Japanese people vote

2023 Google has just lost an
antitrust lawsuit against the company  Epic
Games, the maker of the game Fortnite,
filed a lawsuit against Google in 2020,
accusing it of illegal monopolistic behavior
related to the Google Play app store.
Epic Games accused Google of
squeezing competitors.  Competition and
overcharging
application developers for up to 30 minutes after
more than a month of trial  The
jury also
concluded that the connection between the
Google Play app store and the Google Play billing service
was a legal breach of
Google's distribution agreement with
game developers and publishers.  OEM original equipment manufacturing is
also said to be an obstacle to
competition. In January next year, the court will
begin to discuss remedies
and compensate CEO Epic team squin Hoa Ninh for the
above judgment while Google
continues to defend  their business model and
will appeal if the verdict is
upheld. Google may have to change
terms related to
application distribution and developers' profits
to address the shrinking of

on the environment. The Netherlands has launched a floating
farm project that has attracted
world attention at Rotterdam Harbor, a
giant three-storey dairy farm with a
closed production line of cows.  Here,
hay and baskets of oranges are taken from
supermarket juicers in the city, drinking
rainwater collected from robotic machines
used to milk and crunch cow dung to make
organic fertilizer, formate milk and butter.  Because
the cows produced will be consumed
in a small shop right next to the
harbor, many farm owners in the Netherlands
are also planning to open the next floating farm
using the technology of growing
photosynthetic vegetables using indoor lights.
According to experts, floating farms
are a feasible idea that can be popularized
in many areas with different terrains and
climates. Such a farm
does not exist.  Permanent farms that only require
one or two seasons but are easy to grow are
completely organic and biodegradable.
These farms also help reduce
carbon emissions in the trucking sector
because the food is produced locally.
